title: 4 Easy Ways to Hide or Delete Comments in Microsoft Word

steps.title: Make sure comments are displayed.
steps.content: Make sure comments are displayed. If you don't see the Comments sidebar on the right side of the document, do the following: Click the Review tab in the top toolbar. Click the Show Comments drop-down menu in the Comments section. Click Contextual or List .

steps.title: Right-click the comment you want to delete.
steps.content: Right-click the comment you want to delete. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source On a Mac, hold down control while clicking the comment you want to delete.

steps.title: Click Delete Comment.
steps.content: Click Delete Comment . It's in the drop-down menu. This will immediately remove the comment.

steps.title: Click the Review tab in the top toolbar.
steps.content: Click the Review tab in the top toolbar. If you want to quickly delete every comment in the document, it's easy to do. If you don't see the comments, you'll need to display them: Click the Show Comments drop-down menu in the Comments section. Click Contextual or List .

steps.title: Click the down arrow next to "Delete" in the ribbon.
steps.content: Click the down arrow next to "Delete" in the ribbon. It's on the right side of the "Delete" menu. If you're using Windows, you'll see it in the "Comments" section of the ribbon. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Select Delete All Comments in Document.
steps.content: Select Delete All Comments in Document . All comments in the document are now deleted.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This is in the top-left corner of your Word document. This method will delete all comments on your Word document. If you want to reference the comments later, be sure to save a backup copy .

steps.title: Click Info.
steps.content: Click Info . You can find this in the left panel, above Save .

steps.title: Click Check for Issues.
steps.content: Click Check for Issues . This tile is next to the Inspect Document header. A drop-down menu will open.

steps.title: Click Inspect Document.
steps.content: Click Inspect Document . This is the first option. A warning will open. Select Yes to save your file or No to proceed.

steps.title: Click Inspect.
steps.content: Click Inspect . Make sure the box is checked for Comments, Revisions, and Versions .

steps.title: Click Remove All.
steps.content: Click Remove All . This will be at the top, next to Comments, Revisions, and Versions . All comments will be deleted from your Word document. If you don't see this, you don't have any comments to delete.

steps.title: Click the Review tab.
steps.content: Click the Review tab. It's in the blue ribbon at the top of the Word document. A toolbar will appear at the top of the window. Keep in mind that hiding comments does not remove them from the document.

steps.title: Click All Markup.
steps.content: Click All Markup . This is a drop-down box in the Tracking section of the toolbar. A menu will appear. On Mac, click the Markup Options drop-down box instead.

steps.title: Click Original.
steps.content: Click Original . This will temporarily hide the comments from the Word document. If you have the Comments sidebar open on the right, click the X to close it.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This is in the top-left corner. Use this method if you want to prevent Microsoft Word from automatically showing markups when you first open your document.

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . You can find this at the very bottom of the left panel.

steps.title: Click Trust Center.
steps.content: Click Trust Center . This is the last option on the left.

steps.title: Click Trust Center Settings….
steps.content: Click Trust Center Settings… . You can find this button underneath the Microsoft Word Trust Center header. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Privacy Options.
steps.content: Click Privacy Options . You can find this in the left panel, between File Block Settings and Form-based Sign-in .

steps.title: Uncheck "Make hidden markup visible when opening or saving".
steps.content: Uncheck "Make hidden markup visible when opening or saving". This option is underneath the Document-specific settings header.

steps.title: Click OK twice.
steps.content: Click OK twice. This will save your settings. When you open Word again, you won't see your markups.
